fetchRef.string_process:
process fetchRef {
  tag {name}
  input:
    val url
    val name

  output:
    set val(name), file(ref) into kangaRefs, hisat2Refs, simReadsRefs

  script:
    """
    curl ${url} | gunzip --stdout | head -100000 > ref
    """
}

tools_dico.name: CURLS
tools_dico.description:
towards a wider use of basic echo applications in Africa.

BACKGROUND:Point-of-care ultrasound is increasingly being used as a diagnostic tool in resource-limited settings. The majority of existing ultrasound protocols have been developed and implemented in high-resource settings. In sub-Saharan Africa (SSA), patients with heart failure of various etiologies commonly present late in the disease process, with a similar syndrome of dyspnea, edema and cardiomegaly on chest X-ray. The causes of heart failure in SSA differ from those in high-resource settings. Point-of-care ultrasound has the potential to identify the underlying etiology of heart failure, and lead to targeted therapy.

||| HOMEPAGE MISSING!.

||| CORRECT NAME OF TOOL COULD ALSO BE 'ultrasound', 'Cardiac ultrasound resource-limited settings', 'high-resource', 'cardiomegaly SSA'

tools_dico.name: KOREF
tools_dico.description:
Chromosome-scale assembly comparison of the Korean Reference Genome KOREF from PromethION and PacBio with Hi-C mapping information.

The first Korean Reference Genome. KOREF_S means KOREF_Single.

fetchReads.string_process:
process fetchReads {

  input: 
    val reads1url
    val reads2url

  output:
    set val(longtag), val(nametag),file("r1.gz"), file("r2.gz") into FASTQ, hisat2FASTQ, kangaFASTQ

  script:
    nametag = "tmpTAG"
    longtag = ["name":"real", "nreads":"10000", "seqerr":"unk", "rep":"na", "format":"fq"]
    """
    curl ${reads1url} | gunzip --stdout | head -n 40000 | pigz --fast > r1.gz
    curl ${reads2url} | gunzip --stdout | head -n 40000 | pigz --fast > r2.gz
    """

}
fetchReads.string_script:
nametag = "tmpTAG"
    longtag = ["name":"real", "nreads":"10000", "seqerr":"unk", "rep":"na", "format":"fq"]
    """
    curl ${reads1url} | gunzip --stdout | head -n 40000 | pigz --fast > r1.gz
    curl ${reads2url} | gunzip --stdout | head -n 40000 | pigz --fast > r2.gz
    """

kangaSimReads.string_process:
process kangaSimReads {
  label 'biokanga'
  tag {longtag}
  input:
    set val(name), file(ref) from simReadsRefs
    each nsimreads from nsimreadsarr
    each seqerr from seqerrs
    each rep from 1..nrepeat

  output:
    set val(longtag), val(nametag),file("r1.gz"),file("r2.gz") into kangaReads, hisat2reads, fa2fqreads           

  when:
    nsimreads > 0 
  
  script:
    nametag = name+"_"+nsimreads+"_"+seqerr+"_"+rep
    longtag = ["name":name, "nreads":nsimreads, "seqerr":seqerr, "rep":rep, "format":"fa"]
    """
        biokanga simreads \
        --pegen \
        --seqerrs ${seqerr} \
        --in ${ref} \
        --nreads ${nsimreads} \
        --out r1 \
        --outpe r2 \
        && pigz --fast r1 r2
    """
}
kangaSimReads.string_script:
nametag = name+"_"+nsimreads+"_"+seqerr+"_"+rep
    longtag = ["name":name, "nreads":nsimreads, "seqerr":seqerr, "rep":rep, "format":"fa"]
    """
        biokanga simreads \
        --pegen \
        --seqerrs ${seqerr} \
        --in ${ref} \
        --nreads ${nsimreads} \
        --out r1 \
        --outpe r2 \
        && pigz --fast r1 r2
    """

fasta2mockFASTQ.string_process:
process fasta2mockFASTQ {
  tag {longtag}
  input:
    set val(longtag),val(nametag),file(r1),file(r2) from fa2fqreads

  output:
    set val(longtag), val(nametag), file ("*.q1.gz"), file("*.q2.gz") into MockFASTQ

    """
    zcat ${r1} | fasta2fastqDummy.sh | pigz --fast --stdout > "${nametag}.q1.gz"
    zcat ${r2} | fasta2fastqDummy.sh | pigz --fast --stdout > "${nametag}.q2.gz"
    """
}
fasta2mockFASTQ.string_script:
"""
    zcat ${r1} | fasta2fastqDummy.sh | pigz --fast --stdout > "${nametag}.q1.gz"
    zcat ${r2} | fasta2fastqDummy.sh | pigz --fast --stdout > "${nametag}.q2.gz"
    """

tools_dico.name: FastQC
tools_dico.description: This tool aims to provide a QC report which can spot problems or biases which originate either in the sequencer or in the starting library material. It can be run in one of two modes. It can either run as a stand alone interactive application for the immediate analysis of small numbers of FastQ files, or it can be run in a non-interactive mode where it would be suitable for integrating into a larger analysis pipeline for the systematic processing of large numbers of files.

multiQC.string_process:
process multiQC {
  input:
    file f from fastqc_results.collect()

  output:
    file "*multiqc_report.html" into multiqc_report
    file "*_data" into multiqc_data

    """
    pwd
    multiqc . -f
    """
}

tools_dico.name: MultiQC
tools_dico.description: MultiQC aggregates results from multiple bioinformatics analyses across many samples into a single report. It searches a given directory for analysis logs and compiles a HTML report. It's a general use tool, perfect for summarising the output from numerous bioinformatics tools.

hisat2Index.string_process:
process hisat2Index {
  label 'hisat2'
  tag{name}
  input:
    set val(name), file(ref) from hisat2Refs

  output:
    set val(name), file("hisat2db.*.ht2") into hisat2dbs

    """
    hisat2-build ${ref} hisat2db -p 8
    """
}

hisat2Align.string_process:
process hisat2Align {
  label 'hisat2'
  tag {longtag}
  input:
    set val(longtag0), val(name), file(r1),file(r2) from hisat2reads.mix(hisat2FASTQ)
    set val(dbname), file("hisat2db.*.ht2") from hisat2dbs

  output:
    set val(longtag), val(tag), file("${tag}.bam") into hisat2BAMs

  script:
    tag = name+"_vs_"+dbname+".hisat2"
    longtag = longtag0.clone()                     
    longtag.ref = dbname
    longtag.aligner = "HISAT2"
    format = longtag["format"]=="fq"?"-q":"-f"
    """
    hisat2 -x hisat2db ${format} -1 ${r1} -2 ${r2} \
    | samtools view -bS -F 4 -F 8 -F 256 - > ${tag}.bam
    """
}
hisat2Align.string_script:
tag = name+"_vs_"+dbname+".hisat2"
    longtag = longtag0.clone()                     
    longtag.ref = dbname
    longtag.aligner = "HISAT2"
    format = longtag["format"]=="fq"?"-q":"-f"
    """
    hisat2 -x hisat2db ${format} -1 ${r1} -2 ${r2} \
    | samtools view -bS -F 4 -F 8 -F 256 - > ${tag}.bam
    """

tools_dico.name: TAG
tools_dico.description: A tool for metatranscriptome assembly using de Bruijn graph of matched metagenome as the reference.

tools_dico.name: DEFormats
tools_dico.description: Covert between different data formats used by differential gene expression analysis tools.

tools_dico.name: HISAT2
tools_dico.description: Alignment program for mapping next-generation sequencing reads (both DNA and RNA) to a population of human genomes (as well as to a single reference genome).

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

kangaIndex.string_process:
process kangaIndex {
  label 'biokanga'
  tag{name}
  input:
    set val(name), file(ref) from kangaRefs

  output:
    set val(name), file(kangadb) into kangadbs

    """
    biokanga index \
    -i ${ref} \
    -o kangadb \
    --ref ${ref}
    """
}

kangaAlign.string_process:
process kangaAlign {
  label 'biokanga'
  tag {longtag}
  input:
    set val(longtag0), val(name),file(r1),file(r2) from kangaReads.mix(kangaFASTQ)
    set val(dbname),file(kangadb) from kangadbs

  output:
    set val(longtag), val(tag), file("${tag}.bam") into kangaBAMs

  script:
    tag = name+"_vs_"+dbname+".biokanga"
    longtag = longtag0.clone()                                                                   
    longtag.ref = dbname
    longtag.aligner = "BioKanga"
    """
    biokanga align \
    -i ${r1} \
    -u ${r2} \
    --sfx ${kangadb} \
    --threads ${task.cpus} \
    -o "${tag}.bam" \
    --pemode 2 \
    """
}
kangaAlign.string_script:
tag = name+"_vs_"+dbname+".biokanga"
    longtag = longtag0.clone()                                                                   
    longtag.ref = dbname
    longtag.aligner = "BioKanga"
    """
    biokanga align \
    -i ${r1} \
    -u ${r2} \
    --sfx ${kangadb} \
    --threads ${task.cpus} \
    -o "${tag}.bam" \
    --pemode 2 \
    """

tools_dico.name: TAG
tools_dico.description: A tool for metatranscriptome assembly using de Bruijn graph of matched metagenome as the reference.

extractStatsFromBAMs.string_process:
process extractStatsFromBAMs {
  label 'samtools'
  tag {longtag}
  input: 
    set val(longtag), val(nametag), file("${nametag}*.bam") from kangaBAMs.mix(hisat2BAMs)

  output:
    file statsFile into statsFiles
    val longtag into longtags

  script:
    statsPrefix = longtag.values().join("\t")+"\t"
    """
    echo -ne "${statsPrefix}" > statsFile
    samtools view ${nametag}.bam | extractStatsFromBAM.sh >> statsFile
    """
}
extractStatsFromBAMs.string_script:
statsPrefix = longtag.values().join("\t")+"\t"
    """
    echo -ne "${statsPrefix}" > statsFile
    samtools view ${nametag}.bam | extractStatsFromBAM.sh >> statsFile
    """

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

combineStats.string_process:
process combineStats {
  input:
    file("statsFile*") from statsFiles.collect()
    val longtag from longtags.first()
    
  output:
    file allStats into allStatsForFigs, allStatsForDoc
    
  script:
  statsHeader = longtag.keySet().join("\t")+"\t"+"Matches\tAlignments\tMatchRate"
    """
      cat <(echo -e "${statsHeader}") statsFile* >> allStats
    """
}

MOCK_generateReportMatter.string_process:
process MOCK_generateReportMatter {
  input:
    file "*figure" from figures.collect()
    file allStats from allStatsForDoc
                                                              
                                                                  
    file "*multiqc_report.html" from multiqc_report
    file "*_data" from multiqc_data
    file docheader

  script:
    """
    echo
    """
                               
                                        
                                     
                                      
         
}
